website_summaries.verdict: Comparable to higher end pool ladders, especially in terms of stability and height. We like the non-corrosive plastic construction and reinforced tread design.
pros: Side rails can be stabilized with water, no sandbags needed
cons: Does not make full contact with pool frame

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty solid ladder. I have a 52 inch high above ground pool, so anything is going to be a little shaky, but this makes me feel a lot safer having guests and my little ones over. I bought this to replace the ladder that came with my 22 ft round Intex pool. I love the easy pull down cover for the steps. I really like that it fills with water instead of sand, and you don't have to secure it to the pool.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my 22' Intex pool
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my 22' Intex pool. Yes a tiny bit of wobble because it can't attach to the top metal rim but such a huge improvement from the ladder that came with the pool. And the top platform is very large and comfy to sit on. There were a few holes that had to be pre-drilled before I could assemble but no big deal. All in all very happy with this ladder. Saw a review that stated it floats but I haven't had that problem, just filled the legs with water as instructed
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, put it together by myself before my wife got home as a surprise. 10xs sturdier than the original Intex Ladder. I have the 32'x16'x52" Intex Ultra Frame rectangular pool and this ladder sits just above the top rail of the pool. I used the stabilizer bars just above the top rail and some stakes on the outside legs to keep it from moving at all. The wife loves the sturdiness, the wide platform at the top, and the fact that it can be locked to keep kids/others from using it is a great bonus. I would definitely suggest buying this!
customer_reviews.author: CajunFireman

customer_reviews.title: Very Safe and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The ladder that came with our pool was very thin and wobbly. So we bought this one based on the positive reviews. It was not hard to assemble, took under an hour. We love it! Now we feel very safe getting in and out of the pool. My husband is a little over 300 pounds and feels safe on this ladder. I included a picture of our original ladder and this new one.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. C

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Stable!
customer_reviews.text: When we originally purchased our pool the ladder that came with the pool always seemed unstable. It eventually broke, so we purchase this one based off the reviews and having two small children. This ladder was very easy put together, but on initial assembly it’s good to have two people. The instructions came be a little vague, but if you’re used to assembling furniture or other things it’s not too complicated to figure out. After using it for the first time I can say it clearly does stand up to the positive reviews we read. Extremely stable and excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Gamble

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for keeping the kids and the dogs safe and out of the pool! It took me about 2 hours to put together myself. It took both my husband and myself to put it in the pool and fill with water. It did float a little until we got it full of water, and now it’s super sturdy. Love how much wider it is than the ladder that came with the pool, and the landing at the top is plenty big enough for turning around to come down the other side. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great iem.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised . Easy setup. I did not want to drill holes into the frame of my Intex pool. I instead made clamps out of pvc trim to attach it to the frame. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: otis

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ladder
customer_reviews.text: It is well constructed, rated at 300 pounds. For reference, most of the ladders you see in the home improvement stores are rated at 225 or 250 pounds. Assembly was pretty intuitive with well written instructions.There are a couple of holes which need to be drilled out but most of it just snapped together. I did it myself in about an hour, but would have gone faster with four hands instead of just two. I bought this for a friend, but I have been in the pool industry for over 20 years now and safety has always been paramount. Solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Bill J

customer_reviews.title: Best investment this far
customer_reviews.text: This is the most perfect pool ladder that ever was. It accommodates everyone of our families needs. And we have a large group of people. It's very easy to put together and it will last. My favorite part is the piece that comes down and covers the steps so no littles can climb up....it even has a piece that locks so the older littles can't pull it up if you don't want them to. I'm in love with this ladder My husband is in love with the fact that is made in the USA. All the way. 🤣🤣
customer_reviews.author: Amazonpro2424

customer_reviews.title: Not 2 bad....
customer_reviews.text: It's very easy to put together. It's made of thick hard plastic. You have to fill the holes with water or the ladder won't sink to the bottom. It needs to be bolted to the pool frame in order for it to be completely sturdy. I think it a decent product, The safety bar is the best feature and it comes with a lock. I was always taking my old ladder in and out every night. I would recommend over the unstable index ladder.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: but not to bad. Mostly it just "snaps" together
customer_reviews.text: It took my husband a bit to get it assembled, but not to bad. Mostly it just "snaps" together. We put it in our pool and be patient, it takes a bit for the air to come out and sink. Once it does, its there to stay. We like this ladder very well. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl R Fillmon

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but tall!!
customer_reviews.text: This took a little bit to assemble but if you take the time to read the directions - and follow them - it takes about an hour to assemble properly. If you don’t have a rubber mallet handy, as suggested in the directions, use a scrap piece of 2 x 4 to protect the part you are banging into place and then hit the 2x4 with a regular hammer instead, knocking the steps into place. All in all this ladder is sturdy, the locking mechanism works well, but the ladder platform itself is quite a bit higher than our previous ladder. Kids were a bit freaked out by that at first. Quality product - recommended.
customer_reviews.author: NoNameRequired

customer_reviews.title: Save you money, no more study than original ladder
customer_reviews.text: It’s not any sturdier than the cheap ladder that came with the pool... I can’t return because it has to be unused and sealed in original box.... well we installed it and opened all the little packages to build it! We have to build a small stair and deck for safety... which isn’t a problem, I just now have this ladder I can’t return because it is too wobbly for my husband to use. If safety is a concern, save your money and build a little deck
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, nice lock. 300lb?? Not so much
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for 2 reasons, the cover which is great, completely blocks access and is lockable. Then I also bought it because it was rated to 300lbs, well I weigh 250lbs and I don't think I would want someone 300lbs on this thing. It is pretty sturdy all hooked down with the legs filled with water, but the top platform has quite a bit of flex to it with me on it enough that I am careful where I put my feet. I keep them to the outsides near the posts so I don't bend the center down. The steps also have some flex to them but not as bad. Was really expecting more for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jfolsom

customer_reviews.title: Solid 4/5
customer_reviews.text: So this is 9million times better than the Rickey pieces of metal you get with your above ground pool....BUT: keep in mind that you are spending $200 on it, so you should have high expectation. For the most part we are satisfied, but there are a few issues. This thing shakes and wobbles like no other. We are looking at ways to better secure it to the ground based on other review recommendations. BEWARE OF EARWIGS. We have found that they LOVE to house themselves into the nooks and crannies of the ladder. Spray it all down with bug deterrent if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Lil_lizzie

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than the local pool supplier!
customer_reviews.text: This ladder provided an extra layer of protection for our above ground pool last season. Our local pool supplier sold the same brand ladder for close to $100 more! Easy to put together for one person. If you have a shorter pool, this will be a high climb and can be wobbly if not secured. We bought ours knowing we were upgrading to a larger pool this. To make it work last year, we ziptied it around the pool posts to make it sturdier. The kid's never complained and I felt better knowing my toddler couldn't access the pool ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great set of stairs
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait a little bit before reviewing this product. This is the second summer having these stairs. They are great and have held up wonderfully. They were not that hard to put together. We read the directions and between me and my husband we had them put together in about an hour. We did not install the safety gate since our child is older. We have grand parents use these stairs with easy as well as our teenage son and his friends. I read many reviews on many products and it took me a year to finally make my choice. I am extremely happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Lahr Kerce

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, safe ladder at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this ladder. But, I do have one note on sturdiness. It will be a bit wobbly if you DON'T attach it to the top rail of the pool. Meaning, if you get this for one of those metal frame pools like Intex, SummerWaves, etc, (which I have, but will soon be replacing with a resin pool), just know it'll be a bit wobbly. Not unsafe by any means, but it's designed to be attached and that would add a tremendous amount of rigidity.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Stable ladder and platform
customer_reviews.text: I really like this ladder. It's way more stabe than the one it replaced. It is a plastic ladder so it will float. You can drill 1 hole on the lower back of the leg support that goes into the water so it fills with water. There are holes in the top so it will fill pretty quick. Otherwise it will always be pushing up out of the water. then fastening it to the pool will be much easier. I would put a pad between the liner and steps though. Just so it doesn't rip.
customer_reviews.author: BillyWilliams

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Safe!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy unit. It was easy to assemble for this 69 yr old gal. Had to get help to put it in the pool though. It's much easier to climb in & out of pool than the flimsy ladder that came with it.The seat at top is very sturdy and wide enough to sit on.The sliding "gate" that locks in place under front steps assures me that people won't be using it to climb into when unattended. I also was approved by our code enforcement officer, so I didn't have to put in higher, more expensive fencing. I highly recommend this ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Coates

customer_reviews.title: Great pool ladder!
customer_reviews.text: We had a crappy old ladder from when we originally bought the pool in 2008. Even though the ladder did last that long.. it was definitely time. I didn't want to spend a ton of money but I wanted something that would last. I have a simple 15 ft round pool that has a 52" wall height. This ladder is awesome. I have a 2 year old wild man who needs to stay away from the pool... It works great! Plus it is made in the USA and very sturdy! The improvements they have made on the A frame ladder is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend
customer_reviews.text: I regret my purchase. This ladder is not stable and wobbles. I didn't feel safe standing on the top platform and turning around on top. I don't recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Big G

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Going on my 2nd year of owning this ladder and all is still well. My only complaint is the stability. Even after adding water to weigh it down it still rocks quite a bit. Not the fault of the company as I have this set up to an intex pool(which is clearly says not suitable for intex lol). It's actually a tad taller and doesn't meet the rails thus creating the wobble effect. The product itself is fantastic. I do like the rolling gate feature. I would recommend this ladder.
customer_reviews.author: lor7549

customer_reviews.title: This ladder is a beast
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy to assemble. Very sturdy especially when compared to the original ladder that came with the pool. It is pretty substantial and fairly heavy once filled with water. It does work with Intex soft-sided pools but cannot be affixed to the top railing as specified in the instructions. To add stability I staked down the ladder using a couple of ropes and also added a crossed ratchet strap (see pic). It is very sturdy now, with little wobble. The ladder is very tall. almost like a lifeguard tower. Good quality for the money.
customer_reviews.author: David Pierson

customer_reviews.title: Good kid safe ladder.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quality ladder. Attaches well to the pool. My kids love jumping off the platform. My tall, active 2 year old can't get past the gate. It is easy to latch closed, but too hard for my 5 year old to unlatch. Pros: Safe, effective, solid, and fun. Cons: bolts to the pool frame, so you have to drill holes. Dumps out about 1 liter of water each time you pull the gate down.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon B.

customer_reviews.title: This is an Awesome Pool Ladder!!
customer_reviews.text: Theirs is an awesome pool ladder - I have had numerous surgeries on my feet, our other ladder had narrow steps and were very hard for me to go up and down! This ladder has steps that are wider in both directions perfect!! Also has the safety a roll down lockable door to keep children from climbing and falling into the pool. It is perfect for my daughter’s pool!! We are all very happy! Thank-you!!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy very unstable
customer_reviews.text: Owned this previously and loved it. The new one is NOT like the old! It looks the same but it’s not. In sturdy, bad wobbly even after filling legs with water. Definitely NOT good quality anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Alex triplett

customer_reviews.title: Safe Affordable Pool Ladder!
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is great and, at this price it think is very affordable. It's constructed out of heavy duty plastic material and, the staircase safety lock feature makes it even better of a product! Please be aware that it is made to hold up to 300 pounds though. Assembly takes about 45 minutes. Instructions don't tell you this but, fill the ladder with water once it's in the pool. Not while it's outside of pool. I had to empty it out half way in order to be able to lift it in to the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy, if secured properly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the cheap-o wobbly ladder that came with the Intex pool we bought at Costco. I know that it's not meant to be used with a pool that doesn't have flat top's on the sides; but I was able to secure it in using a couple of feet of para-cord with cinch knots around the circular pool tubing. The ladder didn't move a bit all summer long.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Wade

customer_reviews.title: good ladder but flimsy steps.
customer_reviews.text: The ladder itself, when fully assembled and installed correctly, is very stable. However, the steps are a little week, and not as rigid as I had expected. I weigh in about 240 on a good day and when I step in the middle of the step, it's a little spongy. Feels like the step is going to fold in half Weight limit is 300lbs. I couldn't imagine it will hold up to that. It works and looks great aside from the flimsy steps. just don't put ALL of the weight in the center of the step, stay to the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this ladder for stability
customer_reviews.text: The plastic parts don't sit flush for assembly (maybe I got a bad kit). Somehow the ladder is less stable than the original that came with the pool. Even adding water to legs inside the pool isn't sufficient to keep them down and stable. If you try to return the defective ladder you'll still pay for shipping and 20-50% restocking fee.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare to assemble
customer_reviews.text: followed instructions to a T. Could not get the top piece to assemble on both sides of the ladder. If the top handrails lign up then the bottom bracket doesn't line up and vice versa.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: Not safe.
customer_reviews.text: This product seems well made however we have two serious issues. The first is that the product really isnt made for an intex above ground pool. It was not sturdy until we placed two braces on each side. The other issie is that it is supposed to hold 300 lbs but it flexes and bends badly after it has been sitting in the sun wuen even a 100 lb child climbs on it. Not worth the money. Tye ladder that came with the intex pool was more sturdy which is not sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth K.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty! Way better than the Intex ladders.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a 24x12x52" above ground Intex pool but the ladder that came with it was not steady at all and was scary climbing up and down. This one was easy to fit together, it is heavy enough that you need two people to move it. The movable ladder cover is my only complaint, sometimes it gets stuck and you have to really jiggle it to get it to open and close.
customer_reviews.author: KDEL

customer_reviews.title: it's great. Although we are still using it
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this ladder is phenomenal, it's great. Although we are still using it, it is very tall for our pool. We have the straight side 18' x 48" Intex Pool. (picture -- it's been raining for a week and we've had it covered, although the water is not clear this will show you how tall it is.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade from original ladder
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy ladder. Have had no problems except that the description said it could fit 48 inch tall pools. It would work, but just barely. We had to improvise to attach it to the pool ledge. It is an intex ultra frame so we used some bungee cords to wrap around and through the ladder and onto the pool ledge. It has worked just fine. This one feels much safer than the one that came with the pool.
customer_reviews.author: KA

customer_reviews.title: Could Have a Wider Base for Stability.
customer_reviews.text: Ladder put together fairly easily. I had a problem screwing the top handles. There were no pre-drilled on back side. This made it difficult to tighten flush, but with some effort I was successful. The enclosure for climbing is a nice feature since I have young grand kids around a lot. The ladder could be better if came with a wide flat base.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Less wobbly than the stock pool ladder
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is way more sturdy than the stock Intex ladder. There is no way to mount it to my type of pool. Even freestanding it is relatively motion free. It fills with water adding stability. The extra width is nice for climbing up and down. We like the safety gate for when we are not home. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We really like this ladder!
customer_reviews.text: Much, much better quality than the ladder that came with our 4'x16' intex pool. Downside is we can't drill it into the pool frame to stabilize it a little more, but I knew that going into the purchase because I did my homework before buying. So, it still has a little wiggle going up and down, but that wide top step makes up for that! Overall satisfied with this purchase and now anyone over 6 can feel safe climbing up and down the ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build
customer_reviews.text: Easy to build, the locking slider is great and it's very sturdy once you mount it to the pool. One thing though, I have a 54" pool and you have to put the top mounting brackets above the rails they fit in (which the directions say is ok) but I had to cut a piece of plastic from the locking mechanism to get the bracket to lay flush. It will still lock but you will need a padlock with a longer shackle. Great ladder and easy on the feet.
customer_reviews.author: caljoe

customer_reviews.title: ... soft side intex pool and this ladder has been great! My husband drilled just a few holes on ...
customer_reviews.text: We have a soft side intex pool and this ladder has been great! My husband drilled just a few holes on either side of the ladder that is submerged in the water to allow more water to fill in and it really assists with the stability since we cant lock it down. Perfect purchase! Works well. Our pool is the 12x25x5. Also the steps are deep and comfortable to climb and the platform is spacious to turn around on or even sit on. Even stays stable after a couple of those need pool margaritas!! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This latter is hands down 500% better than the original that came with my 18' Intex pool. It is a pain to remove from the pool at the end of the season because the water doesn't really have a way to drain out. Also, it created a lot of shade behind the latter so you may end up getting algae behind the latter if you aren't keeping up well with the chlorine, but I would do it all over again just because the latter is that much better than what I had before.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy/Awkward
customer_reviews.text: Not as sturdy as I thought. The braces that attach to aluminum pool sides stink, and the roll door makes a huge mess if you forget to go slow. It brings about 2 gallons of water out if you roll out to fast. Which I seem to all ways do. Wish I could undo this purchase. And I researched a lot. Assembly isn't to hard for 1 person. Top hand rails flimsy at best for an adult. There are bette stairs out there for more money.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Roll top desk design is excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This safety ladder is well designed to prevent pool access by babies and toddlers. When added to good safety training and reasonable vigilance, it gives us peace of mind. It is easy enough to use that it gets used every time someone is not in the pool. Two other ladders we tried had difficult to use methods of pool entry prevention, one was slide the ladder up and lock it, and the other was remove the ladder and take it inside. This is about as perfect as a safety ladder could get, and is fairly priced.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Cottrell

customer_reviews.title: Security is nice.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy ladder. Definitely better than what came with our pool. (Intex 18’ Ultra) It was fairly simple to put together. Husband and I had it done in about 1/2 an hr. Two people wasn’t really necessary but it was helpful and made quick work. My only complaint is the ring for locking the ladder. It’s really stiff and I’m fairly short (5’). Hard to get it pulled out. Other than that this one is pretty awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Russell

customer_reviews.title: Worthless piece of plastic!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this ladder because it was highly rated and would hold up to 300 pounds. It will only hold my 60 pound daughter and even then it shakes! The screws pop out when my husband tries (he is less than 300) to climb up and the plastic twists. It is the most worthless piece of plastic I have ever seen! We missed the return window because we had to wait for a cement patio to be poured before we could set up our pool. I feel like we were cheated out of several hundred dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Anderson

customer_reviews.title: great pool ladder compared to the ladder supplied with an ...
customer_reviews.text: great pool ladder compared to the ladder supplied with an intex pool. this ladder is designed to be attached to top edge of pool for stability. our pool would not support this option so the ladder was unstable. I used some rope and tied the ladder to the top edge of the pool and this helped a lot. I order the LAK (ladder adapter kit) from the confer website. It cost about $40 but worth every penny. the ladder is now very stable and a pleasure to use and own.
customer_reviews.author: darrel mcclain

customer_reviews.title: This is a awesome ladder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ladder for my Son's above ground pool because the ladder that came in the pool kit was junk. This ladder is sturdy, he said it was easy to put together and the safety features are awesome. There is no way a child could get the lock off or raise the blind that covers the steps.
customer_reviews.author: NT

customer_reviews.title: VERY HEAVY DUTY...locking steps guard is GENIUS...  EXCEPT for
customer_reviews.text: the only braces they give you to attach the ladder to the pool are prefit for flat surface rails. My pool rails are rounded... the locking steps guard is GENIUS... WATER fills the empty cavity of the ladder. Might be MUCH better if the water holes were big enough to fill with SAND...
customer_reviews.author: C.Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best pool ladder ever!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new pool ladder, it is very sturdy, and the steps are wide and don't hurt my feet to climb. I am 65 and this ladder helps me get in & out of my aboveground pool with ease! And the lock down feature is a great safety feature with grandkids. Thank you, it's a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Shirley gahagan

customer_reviews.title: It's a lot of ladder!
customer_reviews.text: It's a beautiful ladder, however after putting the in and out steps together, I am unable to put the top on that holds it together! I had a fella come over to help but the two of us found it to be impossible! I don't know if I'm doing it wrong...I followed the instructions closely.im usually very adept at putting things together. Seems to me three people are needed for completion! I know it will be perfect for me...after all that is why I ordered it!
customer_reviews.author: S. Hartnett

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy ladder!
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is a million times better than the one that came with my above ground pool! It's very sturdy, wide enough for an adult, and the steps can be covered up when not in use, so little ones can't climb them. Well made and easy to assemble. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Linda from Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Ladder
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is an excellent ladder to replace the one that came with my pool. Directions were a bit tough to follow and it did not go together as easily as they said. Took 2 of us over 2 hours and it was a struggle! Make sure to read about filling the ladder with the hose when putting it in the pool, otherwise, it will just float and not stay down.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Byrne

customer_reviews.title: easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: If you have a bestway or intex steel frame vinyl liner four foot pool this will be high and wobbly. Get yourself some ratchet straps as other have mentioned on here. They make a world of difference otherwise in my opinion very scary to climb.
customer_reviews.author: Jb

customer_reviews.title: Should have purchased sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I waited so long to purchase. I had been eyeing this ladder for over a year to replace the one that comes with the Intex pool. This ladder was easy to put together. My husband completed it in about 30 minutes. This ladder is very sturdy and has no wobble. I can go up and down without fear of falling. I'd recommend to anyone looking for a replacement ladder.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Webbles wobble but they don't fall down.
customer_reviews.text: The ladder is wobbly, but that may be subjective due to my family's size, all the feels are 6'+ and 200+ lbs. However, it does not wobble to the point of being unstable and is actually a great ladder. The roll down door that locks is great at keeping the dogs and little ones from trying to climb in.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Withers

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and safe!
customer_reviews.text: Love this ladder! Our pool came with a ladder that was wobbly and unstable. We upgraded and couldn’t be happier. It’s so sturdy! We use it with an Intex pool, metal frame, 52” high. The safety slide is also great. Easy use and keeps the kids out.
customer_reviews.author: jm

customer_reviews.title: Improved product!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this ladder as a replacement for a Confer 7200 ladder I've been using for about three years with one of the A-Frame pieces, braces and curved grab bars splitting, rendering the ladder unsafe for continued use. The new ladder has some product improvements which I believe will make it stronger and hopefully it will last longer than three years this time.
customer_reviews.author: Billy709

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids, not so much for Adults
customer_reviews.text: Pros : very easy to assemble, truly all you need is a dead blow, and Philips head. Is very sturdy. Cons : this ladder is sturdy however the heavier you are the less sturdy it is. I’m 6’1” and 295lbs I have to be very careful how I clime. You are given a bracket to aid in stability that only works with hard sided pools.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Jones

customer_reviews.title: It's not hard to put together takes time but it ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not hard to put together takes time but it is a very solid ladder we have a 15'x4' above ground pool the ladder is a foot higher than we need but it work's I secured it to the ground with 2, 3 ft. metal stakes one on each leg than used 3 zip tie's on each leg and stake hold's very well I am 250lbs and have no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Pat G.

customer_reviews.title: Good safe ladder
customer_reviews.text: Kind of whobley, but does hide the ladder very well. Steps kind of small when cover slide is in place. I have size nine feet ( not large feet) and I almost have to turn my feet sideways when I climb up the ladder to get out of the pool. That hurts my ankle that has screws holding the ankle together.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Confer Plastic A-Frame Steps are Great!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 63 year old female and by following the directions it was very easy to put together. Some places on the steps had to be stripped of some excess plastic in order to fit but over all was very easy. The steps are very sturdy and fit nicely in my pool. Top platform is nice size to sit down on. Over all the steps are made of good quality material and should last for years. I have a 52 in Intex metal frame pool and I always attach the ladder to the pool using a bungycord on both sides for stability. You also fill the steps with water to help weigh them down and for stability.
customer_reviews.author: S. Levison

customer_reviews.title: Not bad. Better than original ladder
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and looks nice, but even with the ladder full of water, for the weight, it’s still a bit flimsy. If you are fat you’ll never get your butt through the top handles. I’m not overly fat but I fit a little snugly.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: Good ladder
customer_reviews.text: We are pretty happy with this ladder. Good sturdy quality and not too bad for assembly. If you want it to be more sturdy you have to mount it to the pool like the directions say so maybe that’s why people have issues ? Not sure but we like ours.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Lady

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money, use YouTube!
customer_reviews.text: Have a 12X24 Intex Ultra Frame Pool. Lader wasn’t to difficult putting together using a YouTube video as a reference. The instructions with it suck. Definitely will need a rubber mallet. Didn’t get the stabilizer Kit, but I should have. It’s still more sturdy than the OEM ladder it came with. Don’t forget to fill the holes on each step and at the top of each ladder rung with water, inside the pool and outside.
customer_reviews.author: Paulinnola

customer_reviews.title: Once you fix the wobble, it's all good.
customer_reviews.text: It is a very good ladder system, but you have to get a little creative when using it. There is a lot of wobble when your on the top. I drove down into the ground, 2 eight foot steel rods 1/2 way down into the ground on each side of the ladder and secured the ladder to the rods. This took just about all the wobble out. Goes together fairly easy. I put it together by myself, but an extra set of hands would have been useful, especially when assembling the top platform. But all in all its a good buy for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: John Z.

customer_reviews.title: It went together easily, I did need to trim on small spot ...
customer_reviews.text: There were a lot of negative reviews for this ladder and I understand that not everyone is mechanically inclined. It went together easily, I did need to trim on small spot of plastic that was missed at the factory. following the instructions and mounting the ladder to the pool it works just as advertised. No issues and very solid.
customer_reviews.author: dugzilla

customer_reviews.title: It wobbles, but won’t fall down. Get the stabilizer part for the bottom of the ladder.
customer_reviews.text: Good and sturdy standing on it. But when you walk up or down it wobbles a little, enough that it is a while to feel totally safe. I bought the stabilizer bar for it towards end of last Summer and haven’t put it on yet. But plan to this next Month. I’m sure it will help with that. It was really hard to find the part online. Somehow I finally did. But call the Company and ask they can tell you the part # if you’d like one. Have FUN!
customer_reviews.author: Laura stewart

customer_reviews.title: Safe!
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the standard ladder that came with our intex 18ft pool. We had a very determined 7 year ASD kiddo attempting to get in, no matter how hard he tried he couldn't! I feel much safer having this in our backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Runner Mom

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I wasted my money buying this ladder. It really looks pretty and sturdy but when you put it in the water even after filling the legs with water its wobbly and you feel like your gonna fall off. The last straw was it started leaning to the side and I felt like I was gonna fall off. I have an Intex pool and I see why they say don’t use it with those pools because you can’t mount it to the pool. I dont understand how some people used it with an Intex pool. I ended up using the original ladder that came with the pool. That ladder was sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Ronell Vismale

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Stable pool ladder
customer_reviews.text: Quality made right here in the US. This was a great purchase and good investment for my aging pool. Excellent instructions and a sturdy pool ladder is the result. It was not terribly difficult to put together, much of it snapped together as it was designed to do. There are not a ton of screws to deal with and the instructions were well laid out. We are very pleased with this ladder!
customer_reviews.author: LadyGar

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality AND made in the U.S.A.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased an Intex pool this summer and were looking to replace the ladder that came with the pool with one that was sturdier. We read the other reviews and decided on this ladder. We were NOT disappointed. This ladder is well made, sturdy, attractive and was relatively easy to assemble. (My husband was able to do it w/no problems other than he needed a bit of my assistance a couple of times.) :) We are very pleased with this ladder and anticipate we will have it for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: jmg

customer_reviews.title: Not very stable
customer_reviews.text: For the money, I thought that this ladder would be very stable but it is not. It wobbles from side to side. It will hold a 300 lb person who is on it but it moves a lot while climbing in an out of the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Extremely hard to put together, nothing matches up. I do not feel safe climbing the ladder and have to make sure my grandson or daughter is holding on to it while I climb. I wish I never would have spent the money it is NOT WORTH IT. I had high hopes, because I didn't think the ladder that came the pool was safe, but it was much more sturdy than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ladder Has held up great
customer_reviews.text: Held up a through 4 kids and 3 adults . The safety feature is excellent easy to to do and keeps the little ones out of the pool when needed. The ladder has a large deck so its very safe . Very nice ladder.
customer_reviews.author: destiny

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to the stock ladder
customer_reviews.text: Good ladder with easy to use safety features. The only thing that I wish was better was the sturdiness. Our pool is a 48” so it’s on the bottom of the adjustment. At 1st I zip tied it but it was fairly wobbly. I ended up bolting it to the pool. The bolts could have been longer but I made it work.
customer_reviews.author: H. Pressley Robinson III

customer_reviews.title: Great Ladder.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great add for an Intex pool. It keeps the kids out when closed and locked. The platform at the top is great for the little ones to jump in the pool and also for mom or dad to get in without a wobbly ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Muhhh
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, I watched a YouTube Video on how to do it, I recommend. It is good quality, but it did shake alittle. Thinking I should have just spend a little more on a better one.
customer_reviews.author: ANNAMARIE👑

customer_reviews.title: Sturdier and Safer!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this ladder to replace the scary, flimsy one that came with our big Intex pool. I even feel much safer climbing it, cause it's so much sturdier and ALOT less wobbly, and it makes getting into the pool much easier! The top landing is bigger with taller handles, giving me piece of mind when the grandkids use it.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon F

customer_reviews.title: Be serious about your purchase or could cost you more!
customer_reviews.text: Tried returning because was unauthorized purchase and now I have to pay shipping to go back. This thing is huge - it’s going to cost a fortune. Highly disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharpie Liquid Pencil

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & spacious
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy pool ladder that adults can feel comfortable about using. The steps are nice and wide and the top platform if spacious. The safety cover for the ladder can be tricky at times so you have to be sure that the lock on the side is pulled out all the way before trying to pull the cover back up. Overall, after a month of use, I would definitely purchase this ladder again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Miller

customer_reviews.title: it was easy to put together and it is a heavy duty ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan....it was easy to put together and it is a heavy duty ladder, but mine is real "wobbly"....I thought that I did something wrong, but I checked the instructions 3 times,... and I had done everything correctly. I would have sent it back, but the box was thrown away.
customer_reviews.author: toby

customer_reviews.title: Good ladder
customer_reviews.text: We much prefer this plastic ladder to the metal one that came with our pool. The metal one was rusty and unsafe in under a year. We've had this one for several months and it's good as new. Seems like it will last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Overall it’s a nice ladder. But not as sturdy when getting into pool as expected. A little shaky. Step material is a little scratchy to feet but ok. Steps feel more solid than my last ladder. I like the safety features and ability to lock the steps with the roller feature. Good price and fast delivery appreciated. Holds over 300 lbs which is nice. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great for above pool
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with the sturdiness and safety equipment for this ladder. It is easy to place back the protection to avoid little ones getting on the pool. At least, one extra barrier.
customer_reviews.author: Ivana Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: 3 Years going strong - Best purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: This ladder rocks my face off. We store it inside during winter, and bring it out every Summer. Very little signs of wear and tear 3 years later. Well worth the money. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Katie D

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly caveat emptor
customer_reviews.text: What letter is extremely wobbly looks like it would be stronger than it actually is for the money I think there are better options out there well maybe not for the money but may be beneficial to buy something more expensive and safer.
customer_reviews.author: Lamar Paige, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Our pool is 54” tall , this ladder just fits. Well built, safety slide is a must have to keep the little ones out. Use the lock!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Sturdier than Intex ladder, but still wobbles a LOT
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is very heavy once installed in the pool and filled with water. The steps and overall build of the ladder feels sturdier than the Intex ladder that came with our pool, but climbing up it, turning around at the top and climbing down into the water, the ladder is still very wobbly. We had a hired handy man put it together with his drill. He said he had to cut out the opening of the holes because a lot of plastic was covering them, so it took him about 30 min to put together or so. Not too bad. Just wish it didn't feel as though it was going to tip over using it (it hasn't....yet.)
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe Garbage Ladder
customer_reviews.text: Horrible ladder. I can not screw through the rigid plastic and so the ladder is not connected safely. They should predrill. I wanted to send it back but I can’t figute out how to send it. Ack. Love throwing 200.00 in the Garbaage 🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬
customer_reviews.author: Luna28

customer_reviews.title: it's GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what we want, keep our little grand kids safe! They are not able to slide the safety rails so that's a win. It is a bit wobbly. We put a piece of wood under the outside legs to keep them even. We have a 16x48" pool so the ladder is high enough. We don't screw anything from the ladder into the pool rim, which I've seen some do. For safety, it's GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Extremely child safe
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact that the slider is to hard for my grandchildren to be able to get it out of the way to use the stairs. However we keep it locked when we aren’t in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Kay Towe

customer_reviews.title: This ladder is sturdy, and I feel much safer getting in and ...
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought this to begin with and never used the ladder that came with the pool. That ladder was a cheap aluminum one that rusted out in our salt water pool after only two seasons. This ladder is sturdy, and I feel much safer getting in and out of the pool now. The roll guard is also a nice safety feature. I really can't say enough nice things about his ladder. My husband put it together in a couple hours with no trouble at all. The color is very neutral and it blends in nicely with the pool liner and landscape.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Larson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this ladder after reading some pretty good reviews. However, I was very disappointed. It wobbles back and forth, tips over sideways rather easily for anyone over the weight of a 6 year old and when the temp is hovering around 95 or higher, the plastic gets so soft it bends when you climb it to get in the pool. Not happy with it at all. Wish I could have returned it but since you have to put it together, then fill it with water and have it in your pool, it was too late. Totally bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Dsheldon2009

customer_reviews.title: Read everything first!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy pool ladder. It took me and my 12 year old about an hour to put together. Read the instructions all the way through before starting and lay everything out in order needed. Make sure you know what screws go where!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everybody's happy stability is great
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery 2 days before delivery date. Love this ladder for adults and children. The safety features are great. We have a Colman 22×52 pool. Sets on concrete. No problem getting in or out. Took awhile to put together instructions are the best. Watch the video helps a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene

customer_reviews.title: Pool ladder
customer_reviews.text: Went together very easily, only 4 screws, the rest was connected with light taps from my rubber mallet. Minor trimming of pieces of plastic from manufacturing process may be necessary but easily taken care of with a sharp knife. Ladder cover has locking mechanism to keep kids out when pool isn't in use. Seems fairly sturdy, I'm 240# and the steps flex a little but extra wide steps make it feel much more sturdy than my OEM ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder
customer_reviews.text: The ladder was a great success in holding family members of all sizes, including people around 250lbs. It holds 300lbs max as stated on the box. Kept granchildren safe. It can tip side to side if your ground is unlevel as ours was but does no tip over easy. It is too heavy for one person to move after wieghed down with the water in the legs. Very strong and sturdy ladder, easy to put together with two people.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: The ladder is pretty nice but not as sturdy as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: The ladder is pretty nice but not as sturdy as I had hoped. For heavier people it is a little wobbly when nearing the top. The 300 lb rating seems a bit high as the steps flex with a lot less weight on them. Assembly was pretty easy and instructions pretty clear. Overall not awful not great. For the money I was hoping for a little more.
customer_reviews.author: M. Spriggs

customer_reviews.title: Good ladder but Moves a lot in intex pool
customer_reviews.text: Ladder doesn’t work great on intex pool.. Really should be mounted to edge ... Whirlpools make it move dramatically and can tear lining.. it’s very wide and sturdy getting in and out but water alone doesnt hold it steady enough...
customer_reviews.author: Mommy13

product_meta.title: Confer Plastics A-Frame 7200 Above Ground Adjustable Pool Roll-Guard Safety Ladder
product_meta.description: Size:Safety LadderConfer plastics LADDER AFRAME 48"-54"W/BARRIER is strong and light. Leader in the industry for aftermarket pool ladders and steps
feature_bullets: Adjusts to fit 48 inch to 54 inch tall pools
Ladder has an extra large platform and is equipped with large 18 inch x 5 inch comfortread steps.
Includes a lockable Roll Guard Barrier that simply rolls over the outer steps when not in use (lock included).
This ladder should not be used with Intex/inflatable/pop-up style pools.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,286 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
